alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 18 at 3:55AM PDT until September 18 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Increased threat of sneaker waves expected. * WHERE...Curry, Coos, and Douglas county beaches. * WHEN...From 8 AM PDT this morning through 8 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Waves can run up significantly farther on a beach than normal, including over rocks and jetties. These sneaker waves can suddenly knock people off of their feet and quickly pull them into the cold ocean waters, resulting in serious injury or death. Waves may also lift driftwood logs, trapping anyone caught underneath. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid climbing on rocks and jetties. Stay away from the ocean and remain out of the water to avoid hazardous conditions.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
